betterquesting:10.desc:8: Chop down trees until you get 32 total logs (they don't have to be the same type)
Make some basic tools and collect 64 cobblestone
Build a nice starter home with your wood and cobble. Make sure to make a bed and sleep in it to set your spawn. Tip: Use slabs to save on blocks for the roof and floor!
Go on your first mining trip. Reminder that you can make charcoal by burning logs (not planks) in a furnace. Don't forget to make torches and bring some food!
Make an iron chest to hold your things
Why use 3 tools when you can use one! Make an iron multi tool so you can chop, dig, and mine with just one tool!
Time to make a nice atlas so we never get lost! You might need to go mining again to make a compass since it needs redstone.
Time to go out and explore! Gliding around should make it easier. Don't forget to mark your home in your atlas before you leave!

When you get tired of your chest being a mess make some storage drawers and a controller to make your life easier.

Use the key to lock drawers so even if you empty the contents only the same items will go in.

As long as all of the drawers are touching each other and at least one of them is touching the controller, you can click the controller to automatically put your items into the drawers.
It's always nice having one or two of these laying around once you have the diamonds to spare.

Cobble is nice to have, and making infinite of it is even nicer!

Put a chest on top to take cobble out, or put a hopper underneath to pipe it into a storage system (like a drawer controller).
Mixing some fresh beef with dirt in a crafting table should make it rotton real quick!

Passive mobs have a chance of dropping bones.

Also mixing dirt and flint in a crafting table will reveal a bone. It's both realistic and morbid!

Mixing charcoal and flint in a crafting table will give you a little bit of gunpowder.

You can also check out the mod Ashenwheat which adds a way to farm gunpowder through Thundergrass.

There are also other ways to get gunpowder like using sulfur.
There are lots of different ways to get string in this pack. Try growing some hemp or cotton for an easy source of string.
Just stick some rotten flesh and a red mushroom in a crafting table and poof! Such realism!
Make some compressed netherrack by filling a crafting table with netherack. Then cook it in a furance to get a blaze rod.
Wrap 8 blaze rods around a bone block in a crafting table to make a wither skeleton skull.
Tinker's Construct adds floating slime islands throughout the world. If your lucky they will have slime trees and you can get a sapling!

You can actually grow Ender Pearls with Ender Lilly Seeds, but be careful because that plant is sharp!

If you don't want to wait for Ender Lillies to grow you can mine Ender Ore and craft Ender Dust into Ender Pearls!

Mixing a litte sand and lapis in a crafting table will give you this guardian drop.

Also mixing glass and lapis will give you prismarine crystal.

Just grab some soul sand and 3 skulls and craft your nether star!

Place 3 skulls in the top 3 slots in the crafting grid, then place 3 soud sand in the middle 3 slots of the crafting grid, then place 1 soul sand in the bottom middle slot of the crafting grid.
Grab yourself some Tea Leaves and cook half of them in a furnace to get Black Tea.
Grab some clay and paper and craft all of your tea making materials.
Take your teapot, fill it up with some water like a bucket, and heat it up in furnace. Then use your tea cup, tea bag (with leaves), and pot to make tea in a crafting interface!
Collect the basic vanilla seeds and make some room for them in your farm!
Find a village (or two) and "borrow" some of their crops.
Enter the nether and find a fortress with netherwart.
The mod all about cooking! We are going to jump straight in and make the second tier book, I hope you got a couple of diamonds laying around!
Make all the basic trappings of a kitchen!
Make yourself some proper cooking utensils to expand your recipe book!

Time to make the most important things a kitchen needs, a toaster and a cow in jar!

Make a cow in a jar by:
 1. Placing an empty jar on the ground
 2. Surroding it with blocks 2 high on all sides
 3. Push a cow on top of the jar
 4. Then place an anvil above the cow so their is one air block between the cow and where you place the anvil so it drops and squishes it into the jar (lol for reals this is the only way)
Even more cooking supplies!
If you ever need to move a chest while keeping the items in it, the Chest Transporter mod is perfect for doing just that!

With the mod "Just a Few Fish" fishing is a little different. For starters the regular fishing poll does nothing now. Time to make the modded version!

Let's skip wood and go straight to iron to start off. Gold has a better chance of getting good enchantments but has low durability and diamond lasts a long time (just like regular vanilla tools!).

Time to bait your hook (place the rod and seeds in a crafting table) and go fishing! Once you get a bite you need to click a few times to reel it in, but not too fast or else it'll break!

There are four types of fish and they each spawn in certain conditions:

Cod spawn in every biome
Salmon spawn in Rivers, Swamps, and Oceans
Clownfish spawn in Oceans
Pufferfish spawn in Oceans
Make 4 iron buckets and fill them with water. If you catch a fish with a water bucket in your inventory they will stay alive and go right into the bucket!

betterquesting:10.name:8: A Place to Live and Thrive
betterquesting:10.desc:8: Make some fish tanks and place your fish in it so they last forever! You can place fish in a bucket into the tank and then drop seeds into the tank so they breed! (I think you need at least 2 of the same type of fish to do that)
Let's start with the basics and make all of the tables and chests you'll need to start tinkering. (Please use Oak Wood when crafting to avoid problems with this quest)
Collect the following materials and craft it all into Grout.

Time to make your smeltery. Cook up all the Grout you made from the last quest in a furnace to make Seared Bricks.

After crafting these items look in the Tinker's Construct Guide Book, Materials And You, for the chapter on building a smeltery.
Collect the first if 3 types of slime tree sapling. These spawn on the floating slime islands in the overworld and fairly common.

First make a Tool Forge, which is required to make certain tools with tinkers.

Make the casts required to make a hammer. You will need to smelt gold into your smeltery then pour it over a stone version of the parts that make a cast (so you might need to make stencils of them to make stone parts).

Let's try and build a better stone pickaxe. This one will last longer and you can repair it! It also will very slowly repair itself if you have it in your hand. 

1.§0§0 §0§1§0Lo§0o§0k up the recipe for blank stencils and put them in the stencil table. Then make all 3 of the stencils for a pickaxe.

2. Then take your stencils and put them in your Stencil Chest (make sure your Stencil Chest is directlynext to your Part Builder!)

2. Next build the 3 parts listed and then combine in the Tool Station to make a pickaxe!

Welcome to Peace of Mind! Some things you should know:

JEI - Just Enough Items (or JEI for short) is the mod that adds a search bar and pages of items to the right of your inventory screen. Hover over an item in your inventory or in JEI and press R to figure out the different ways to get it and U to figure out what it is used for (or press Left Click and Right Click respectively). Also when searching for items you can type "@ModName" in the search bar and only items from that mod will show up. For example, typing @Botania will make it so only Botania items are displayed.

VienMiner - Did you know this pack has VeinMiner?! By pressing the ~ key while breaking a block with the correct tool you can break a whole bunch of the same block at once (it uses a lot of tool durability at once just so you know). This is great for mining a whole vein of ore at once or clearing out lots of stone or dirt. Be carful though, you can't control how much is removed and you might just remove the blocks right below your feet if you're not careful!

Seasons - There is a mod called Serene Seasons that adds seasons to Minecraft! So expect rivers to freeze over and leaves to change colors. Don't be alarmed, this is just for looks. It's fun to see your base in different seasons!

That just about covers everything! You are encouraged to look ahead in this quest book to plan your playthrough! I designed this quest book in a way to guide you through various mods in a natural way but I want you to make this world your own. Thank you so much for choosing to play this pack as it means a lot to me! Click the box to the right to complete this quest!

These are just some descriptions of utility mods you can use in this pack:

Aroma Backup - This mod saves a backup of your world every 30 mins. If you want it to save backups more or less often check out the config file.

Chunk Animator - Not really a utility mod but this was the best place to describe it. This is the mod that makes chunks "slide" or "fall" into the world. If you don't like this mod feel free to remove it from the pack or change the config.

Chunk Pregenerator - This is a great mod that allows players to generate chunks in the world without having to explore them first. This makes exploring new parts of your world less resource intensive on your PC. To use this mod you need to be an admin in your world and use the command /pregen help

Dynamic Surroundings - This mod adds a ton of little things like footsteps, new sounds, and cool particle effects. The config for this mod is quite extensive so if you do not like some features go ahead and disable them to your liking.

Hunger In Peace - This mod makes it so you have to eat in Peaceful Difficulty and disables Peaceful Health Regeneration.

KleeSlabs - This mod makes it so players can press shift to break only the top or bottom slab instead of both.

MouseTweaks - This mod makes it so you can use the scroll wheel to quickly move items between inventories. It makes some small other mouse related changes as well.

Two more crops added by Ashenwheat that can be utlitized to farm materials are Thundergrass and Scintillawheat. 

Thundergrass seeds can be smelted into Unstable Soot which can then be crafted into gunpowder! Craft the seed by combining a regular wheat seed and blaze powder.

Scintillawheat is a slow-growing shimmering crop that can be crafted into hay bales, bread, and cookies! You can also smelt the Scintillawheat bales into an ash that can be crafted into Glowstone Dust! Craft the seed by combining a regular wheat seed and glowstone.

Make some slime boots and a slimesling. Put the boots on and then look the direction you want to go in, turn 180 degrees and aim the slingshot at the ground, charge it up and let go! 

Aim straight down and then use a glider to go far!
You can get the Magma Slime Sapling by exploring the nether.  Slime islands spawn in lava lakes.

Purple Slime Saplings spawn on the same islands as the blue ones but are a bit more rare so you might have to explore a lot to find one. Make sure to mark the location of that island as the purple slime liquid is helpful later.
Collect some Cobalt and Ardite from the Nether. They should be pretty easy to find but require a diamond pickaxe or higher!

Make some Knightslime by grabbing a couple of buckets worth of Purple Slime Liquid from a floating slime island and put it in a smeltery (right click a drain block with a bucket to put the liquid in a smeltery)

Next melt some iron ore and cobblestone(melts into seared stone liquid) and it should slowly mix into Knightslime!

You can cast it into parts or ingots, look in at the Casting quest to learn more!
Cast the following parts by melting the metal/ores in your smeltery them pour them in the casting table with the cast in it. Take the 4 parts and build a hammer in the tool forge!
Portals are another way of getting around quickly. And the long fall boots are better than slime boots!

The Chisel mod is very simple, you make a chisel, right click to open the menu, put just about any block in, and convert it to a different textured block. Great for adding variety to your builds.

Make a chisel and try converting some cobble and wooden planks into some cool blocks to spice up your home!

Craft 4 Red Paper Lanterns. Then in a crafting table, place iron ingots in the top two corners and place string in the top middle slot. Then place the red paper lanterns in any of the other slots to craft hanging lights with the red paper lanterns. 

You can also add glowstone if you want the lights to twinkle. You can craft hanging lights with up to 6 different types of lights if you want to mix different colors or types! 

Use the step ladder to reach high places so it is easier to place the lights!

Chisel & Bits also adds some helpful things like a wooden wrench so you can rotate your creations or a tape measure to make counting blocks across a long distance easier. 

It also adds a diamond saw which you can use in a crafting table to cut blocks in half both vertically and horizontally up to 8 times! The saw is handy if you want half slabs of a block that doesn't exist. 

Lastly you can use the Chiseled Designs to copy your creations easily!
Make a nice table and chairs for your home and feel free to look into the other awesome things Bibliocraft has to offer.

There is another mod in this pack with the word chisel in it and that is Chisel & Bits. This mod allows you to chisel little tiny cubes out of full sized blocks called bits to make very detailed decorations. You can even chisel liquids!

Why don't you make a stone chisel and a bit bag to hold your bits. After you're done crafting, try making a bird bath out of cobblestone bits and water bits. Make sure to press Alt while holding the chisel to change your chisel mode.

Pro Tip: Use the mod Flat Colored Blocks to get bits of any color!

Let's do a little sample test of fairy lights, make one of each light. I'll pick the colors :P

I would try and do this one a little bit over time. Don't forget you need to craft the lights into hanging lights like the previous quest.

Making a quest book is hard and it only lasts for so long. That's why I made this quest! Make a clipboard and put down three things you want to do in your world as your own made up quests :D

Oh it's also super helpful to write down small stuff you want to do for the next time you play so you don't forget.

WARNING: You can place clipboards on a wall but there is a known (slightly rare) crash that occurs when doing so. In order to get back into the world you need to disable clipboards from Bibliocraft in Bibliocraft's config file. Place a clipboard on the wall at your own risk!
Make a nice bookcase from Bibliocraft to store all of your in-game guide books!
Some gunpowder and blaze powder mixed together in a crafting table makes ghast tears, who know?
Wrap 8 popped chorus fruit around some endstone to make a shell of the shulker variety.
Pick your favorite sapling and plant it in a Bonsai Pot so you can have a nice full sized mini tree in your zen house.
Make a Hopper Bonsai Pot and put a chest directly underneath it. Put a sapling in it and over time you will automaticlly get wood! Make more pots for different types of wood!

Craft an Ender Storage ender chest and pouch. These can be color coated with dyes to make different "channels".

You can change a chest's channel by clicking dyes onto the 3 slots on top of the chest. Then shift click a pouch while looking at an ender chest to link it.

A good idea is to set an ender chest near your drawer controller and then use a hopper to transfer the items from the chest into the drawer controller. Then if you have your linked ender pouch in your inventory, you can send items to your storage drawers no matter where you are!

Craft the following helpful things from Drawer Controllers:

- A Drawer Controller can be connected to an array (a bunch of blocks that touch each other) of storage drawers and will connect them all. Then clicking on the controller will auto empty your inventory into your drawers!
Using bonemeal is so vanilla, use a watering can to speed up your crop growth manually!
Tiny Progressions adds 3 tiers of growth crystals. The later two tiers are very expensive but making a tier 1 isn't too hard! It's like automatic bonemeal!

Go explore this awesome star based magic mod!

You can craft an Astral Tome in a regular Crafting Table. But first you will need to find some Aquamarine Shale which can be found in river beds, beaches, and shallow water. Craft some Parchment in a Crafting Table and combine it with a Book and some Aquamarine to begin your Starry Journey!

Go explore this amazing nature based magic mod!

You can easily find these books in small thatch huts throughout the world.

If you want to craft them yourself you will need to make a knife from roots and break some birch logs to get birch bark. Craft three birch bark and a piece of leather into a Birchbark Tome, which is the basis of all three books.
Go explore this incredible flower based magic mod!

This mod adds to the hopper system in minecraft. Hoppers with hopper ducts are a great way to transport items from chests or machines to other inventories.

Use a regular old minecraft stick to change the direction of the ducts after placing them.

The Ceramics mod adds all your clay related needs. It's great for early game buckets when iron is precious. But more importantly it adds barrels and barrel extensions to hold liquid and you can use facets and channels to transfer liquids!
Go explore this beautiful and functional based mod!
The name isn't very good but the mod adds lots of cool mechanical content in a very Vanilla way.

The mod Ashenwheat adds a few new plants that make farming certain items easier while adding some cool new ones. This pack disables getting the mod's seeds from grass and dungeon chest. I've added recipes instead!

Ashenwheat (the item the mod is named after) is a new crop that can be used to craft a few different items and all Ashen items can be used as fuel in a furnace! Smelting Ashenbread will convert it into charcoal making the crop an easy to farm fuel source! Craft the seed using one regular wheat seed and a piece of charcoal.

Ossidroot is another great crop that can be used to make ominous glowy lanterns similar to Jack-O-Lanterns. When Ossidroot is smelted into Calcified Ash, the ash can be crafted into an easy source of Bonemeal. Craft the seed by combining a Pumpkin Seed and Soul Sand.
Make a Diamond Wand to make placing lines of the same block easier! Great when building big!
Go explore this rustic mod full of rustic stuff!

Hopper ducts expand upon minecrafts hopper system. Hoppers, Grated Hoppers, and Hopper Ducts make moving items between chests or machines to other inventories much easier.

Use a regular old minecraft Stick to change the direction of a hopper duct after placing it.
A simple mod which makes finding a particular biome easy. Just click with it in your hand and pick what your looking for!

There is simple mod that adds an elevator block that makes jumping between floors easy!

Just place two elevator blocks so one is directly above another. Then stand on an elevatorand press shift to go down a floor and jump to go up a floor! Chain together as many floors you have!

Waystones is a great mod that makes going back to base or teleporting between bases easy. Craft a waystone and an extra warp stone so you don't have to walk back from a long trip.

Click the waystone after placing it to assign it to you. Then just charge up your warp stone and move to bring up the warp menu.

Find yourself a moonlight circle in the world. It will be a circle of mossy cobblestone pillars. Next you will need to find the 5 markings on the ground within the circle (4 small markings, 1 big one). I find it best to replace the grass with a light colored block with a smooth texture (like white concrete or terracotta) so you can see the markings easier.

Once you find the markings use the circle and your Book of Herblore to make 1 of each of the various Roots' herbs and plants. (Note Runestone is simply made by just dropping Stone onto the big marking/rune)

This mod adds A TON of random content. Stuff like watering cans, power generation, growing ender pearls, and different types of trash cans.

****WARNING****
The EU2 Manual had some issues in the past, it works now but be careful!!

An awesome mod that adds little pets to your inventory that give awesome effects if fed and cared for!

Craft (or find) your pet (rarer ones are more expensive) and press N when it is in your hand to name it.

Craft and fill your feed bag and keep it in your inventory to automaticlly keep your pets happy and fed!

The mod Platforms adds a wide range of platforms that can be used to build decks, bridges, mine shafts, and even roller coasters! The best part is you can use a bunch of materials like wood, ingots, and stone. Build the Platformer and Wrench to get started.

After placing the PlatFormer and accessing it's menu, click the blue information icon on the left for an explanation of how to use the machine.

Use some oak wood planks to craft some items in the PlatFormer. Place your supply of planks in the bottom inventory slots and then place one oak wood planks in each of the two inventory slots to the left of the preview. This tells the PlatFormer to only use that material when crafting platforms. Use the arrow selectors to select the type of output. 

Try using other materials to craft platforms like different types of wood, cobblestone, stone, and metals. You can even use two different materials in the same platform!

Tips: After crafting and placing platforms, use the wrench to rotate them with right click. Shift right click them with the wrench to change the style of the platform. You can also shift left click a platform to add or remove a railing. If you hold the wrench in your offhand while holding platforms in your main hand an overlay will appear of how the platform will be placed.

The mod Comforts adds sleeping bags that can be used to sleep anywhere in the world for the night. The best part is that it doesn't set your spawn so in case you die you will spawn back at your bed and not in the middle of nowhere. 

Shift click the ground while holding a sleeping bag to place it. Then click it to sleep.

You can also just click the sleeping bag while not looking at a block to try and sleep.

Comforts also adds awesome hammocks! They work like sleeping bags in that they don't change your spawn point but they can only be slept in during the daytime. To build one you will need a Hammock Cloth, 2 Rope and Nail, and any kind of wood logs (or planks). 

Start off by making two pillars of wood logs (or planks) about 2 or 3 blocks high and have exactly 4 blocks of space between them (make sure they are facing each other directly, not diagonally). Now place a Rope and Nail on each pillar so they are facing each other and on the same level. Lastly, click either Rope and Nail while holding the Hammock Cloth to attach it. Click the hammock to sit in it and shift click to take a nap during the daytime!

There are a couple of mods in this pack that help players with the ever increasing amount of modded items and the unchanging number of inventory slots. 

Iron Backpacks is a great way to expand your inventory early on. This mod is actively being developed so expect some minor bugs and awesome new features in the future. More quests will be added to the book as new features get added.
Make an Iron Backpack with emphasis on Storage.
Make a Gold Backpack with emphasis on Storage.
Make a Diamond Backpack with emphasis on Storage.

betterquesting:10.name:8: I Can't Hold All These Items
betterquesting:10.desc:8: The Bag Of Holding added by Extra Utilities 2 is a very simple item that allows a double chest full of items to be stored in the bag. The downside is that it costs gold and xp to craft in addition to it not having many extra features.
Make yourself a knife from roots and break some logs with it to get 8 bark of each type of wood.

The mod Doggy Talents adds a new companion mob, Dogs! To start this mod off find a regular wild Minecraft wolf and tame it with bones. Feed it a training treat to convert it into a Doggy Talents dog. Remember to feed him to keep it's health up!

Once you have your new best friend, right click the dog while holding a stick in your hand to access it's menu. From this menu you can name your dog, check it's levels, change it's behavior, and level it up by adding and improving talents!

Make a food bowl anda dog bath for your dog! The food bowl can be used to store food for your dog and refill a treat bag. The dog bath makes your dog shake off water and can be used to get fish if he has the right talent.

Chew Sticks can be given to dogs to save them in a pinch. They give the glowing effect for 5 seconds, the speed VI effect for 10 seconds, and the regeneration effect for 5 seconds.

Throw Bones (and Sticks) are for playing fetch! Set your dog's behavior to Docile mode in the menu then throw the bone and watch 'em go! When the bone is returned it will probably be covered in Drool. Click it to clean it off or put it in a crafting table.

Craft a treat bag and some training treats to level up your dog. You can carry treats and other food items in the treat bag and easily transfer them into a food bowl by clicking the bowl while holding the bag. Giving your dog a treat will level them up but Training Treats only work up to level 20.

Craft a Collar and a Command Emblem for your dog. Right click your dog with the collar to put it on and change it's color using a crafting table or by clicking the dye onto your dog. If you ever want to remove the collar you can use Collar Sheers (that item can also untame your dog too!). The mod also adds some awesome accessories for your dog like sunglasses and more! Check the mod out in JEI to see them all.

The Command Emblem will send commands to your dog using the arrow keys, but only if you are holding the emblem in your hand. The up arrow makes your dog stand up, the down arrow makes it sit down, the left arrow makes the dog stop what it's doing, and the right arrow makes the dog come to you.

If you are scared of losing your dog you can craft a Radar and Radio Collar. Click your dog with the Radio Collar to equip it. Then if you and your dog are in the same dimesion you can click while holding the Radar and it will tell you how far away and in what direction your dog is in.

Make some Super Treats (level 21-40) and Master Treats (level 41-60)  so you can keep leveling up your dog. Since most people will be playing this pack on Peaceful, some of the doggy talents might not apply since they revolve around combat. That's okay since there are many other talents that are still great to invest in! Hunter Dog, Hell Hound, Pack Puppy, Pillow Paw, Shepherd Dogs, Doggy Dash, Fisher Dog, Happy Eater, Rescue Dog, Puppy Eyes, Wolf Mount, and Swimmer Dog are all amazing talents!
Make some Dire Treats and level up your dogs Dire Level. Once your dog hits Dire Level 30 it is fully maxed out and gets cool end-like particle effects!

Two cool little mods are Bird's Nest and Tumbleweed. Bird's Nest have a chance of dropping when chopping down trees and when clicked will have a chance to give you random goodies. Tumbleweeds spawn in hot and dry biomes, like deserts, and when punched have a chance of dropping stuff! Some say there is a chance of finding diamonds in these little natural lootcrates. But you have a better chance of getting some random mob drops or other items.

Craft a Pyre and a Firestarter so you can start preforming some rituals.

Check out the Ritual of the Storm, the Ritual of Light, and many more in the Book of the Natural Arts.
Make yourself a Mortar, Pestle, Big Pouch, Staff, and an Imbuer so you can get started on the basics of druid spellcraft.

Place your Mortar on the ground and then click in items to prepare for grinding. Then click the Mortar with your Pestle to grind your items into a Petal Dust. I've selected 4 different Petal Dusts for you to make, hover over their pictures to see which ones. Use your Book of Spellcraft to figure out the recipes.

You should read through the Roots books but here are some important notes about spell crafting in Roots:

Big Pouches can only hold one herb so if a spell costs 2 different herbs you need two pouches.

Shift Right Click the Staff while in your hand to change which of the 4 slots is selected. The selected slot is shown when you hover over the Staff in your inventory.

Click the Petal Dust onto the Imbuer and then click your Staff onto the Imbuer to bind that spell to the selected slot. 

As long as you have the herb pouches required, you are now free to spellcast away!

Make an Offering Plate and find a Fairy Circle (See Book of Natural Arts) so you can make an offering in exchange for Fairy Dust! Placing this on the ground makes the coolest light source in Minecraft!
Continue making offerings to fairies until they decide to give you a Fairy Charm. Clicking a Fairy with the charm will make bind them to you! Right click them to switchbetween follow and stay mode.

Pam's HarvestCraft adds two very useful blocks called Market and Shipping Bin. 

The Market block allows players to buy various seeds, saplings, passive mob spawn eggs, and more for emeralds! 

The Shipping Bin allows players to sell their hard earned items like crops, fish, and more for emeralds!

Using these two blocks, players can access all sorts of things quite quickly if they play the buy and sell game just right.

On a completely unrelated note, make a well so that way you can have infinite water that looks nice!

The Presser is a block added by Pam's HarvestCraft that allows items to be pressed into various other items. 

Some useful recipes include pressing logs into paper, fruits into juice/bait, and soy into tofu!
Using various baits that you can make in the Presser, you can trap mobs in Ground and Water Traps to get rare mob drops and items.

There are two types of beehives that spawn in this world, one belongs to Pam's HarvestCraft (covered in this quest) and one belongs to Rustic (covered in a different quest).

Breaking a Pam's HarvestCraft beehive will have a chance of dropping a Queen Bee.

Putting that bee into an Apiary will have it produce Honeycombs and Waxcombs overtime. The Queen Bee has a limited life span so you will have to find more to keep up your production.

Use a Honeycomb and a Presser to make Honey. It is used in many food crafting recipes!

Use a Waxcomb (or Honeycomb) and a Presser to make Pressed Wax. Craft that into candles for some nice mood lighting.

Quark is a mod that adds many little things to Minecraft. One of which is Iron Ladders. While they are more expensive to make then regular ladders, Iron Ladders do not need to be placed on a block. So you can make free standing ladders that look really cool.

A cool change that Quark adds to both regular ladders and iron ladders is that you can place a ladder and hold right click to automaticlly place ladders below the one you just placed. To make a big ladder just start near the top and hold right click!

Tip: If you want a cheaper alternative or going for a different look, check out the Rope or Iron Chain added by the Rustic mod as they function exactly the same as described above.

The Trowel added by Quark is great for making paths. When right clicked it will randomly choose a block from your hotbar to place. Depending on the blocks you choose, you can make a ruined wall, a beaten path, and so much more!

The Timer added by Dark Utilities is great for making any redstone contraption that requires a consistent pulse smaller! After placing it click it to set how long it should wait between each pulse.

The Redstone Clock added by Extra Utilities 2 is similar to the Timer but in block form. Sadly you cannot set the time inbetween pulses like the Timer, it always pulses once a second. But the recipe is cheaper!
Dark Utilities adds 3 types of Vector Plates for moving mobs and players around very quickly. Great for moving mobs over short distances or moving around your big base!

Ever wish you could just never pick up cobblestone while mining? Using the null charm, you can set which blocks or items will just disappear upon entering your inventory! Be careful what you throw away, you might end up needing it in the future!

Click the charm while in your hand to open its inventory. Place the items or blocks in it to tell the charm which items to destroy upon entering your inventory.

Quark adds tweaks to Dispensers so that when placed in front of tilled soil and filled with seeds, a redstone signal will plant the seed! This works with vanilla seeds, some modded seeds, jungle wood/cocoa beans, netherwart/soul sand, and chorus fruit/endstone!

Dispensers also now place blocks in the world instead of dropping the block in item form (like a dropper). You can also dispense records into jukeboxes if the jukebox is empty!
The Sickles added by Extra Utilities 2 allows for breaking tall grass and crops in a 3x3 area!
The Sound Muffler is a very helpful block whenever you have a nosiy contraption or machine. Just place it nearby and and any blocks emitting sound near it will be quieter.

Drums have the ability to hold many buckets of one liquid. Quite useful for long term storage! Click it with a bucket of liquid to empty the bucket into the drum. Click it with an empty hand to check how full it is. They support pipe-like inputs like Transfer Pipes, etc.

The Trash Cans added by Extra Utlities are great for voiding items or fluids. Click it after placing to access the menu to throw away your item or apply filters. They support pipe-like inputs like Transfer Pipes, etc.

You can even throw away power but why would you want to do that?
One of the most helpful types of items in modded Minecraft! The Ender Hopper will teleport any nearby items into the chest it is connected to!
Using a Sticky Piston with an Iron Rod placed on the sticky side, you can break any block a regular piston can push! This is great for automating small setups that require you to break a block.
Make some of the most §moverpowered§m§r filling food from Pam's HarvestCraft!

There is also a wand that can be used to remove an area of blocks called the Destruction Wand. It's like a more controlled version of Vienminer. Press Shift or Ctrl while holding to remove a row of blocks.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Most Useful Tools In The Shed
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Engineer's Hammer is Immersive Engineering's most important item. It is used in crafting recipes, activating multi-block structures, and configuring the layout or direction of a block.

The Engineer's Wire Cutter is also used in crafting recipes and has some specific use cases within the mod.

The Engineer's Toolbox is great for storing all of your Immersive Engineering related tools, wires, items, and blocks!

Time to make a Coke Oven. After crafting the blocks, build a solid 3x3x3 cube of Coke Bricks and Right Click the center while holding the Engineer's Hammer to activate the structure. 

You can now cook Coal into Coal Coke while also producing the byproduct Creosote Oil. 

If the Coke Oven's Tank becomes full of Creosote Oil it will no longer cook materials. Make sure you hook up a Ceramic Facet or Fluid Transfer Nodes to move the liquid to a Clay Barrel or Fluid Trash Can respectively.
Treated Wood is one of the most common crafting materials in Immersive Engineering. It also looks awesome and can be crafted into many decortive blocks!

Immersive Engineering uses Capacitors to store Energy. Clicking a block with an Engineer's Hammer will change that side of the block between Input (Blue) and Output (Orange).  You can place Wire Connectors on Capacitors and machines to prepare them for energy transfer. You can then connect two blocks and transfer power by holding Wire Coils in your hand and clicking two Wire Connectors. 

Read the Engineer's Manual to learn the difference between LV, MV, and HV Capacitors, Wire Connectors, Wire Coils, and Transformers.

Note: If a Wire cannot be used to connect two Wire Connectors because they are too far apart, use Wire Relays. Wire Relays CANNOT input or output power to blocks but they can be used to extend Wires over long distances.

The Blast Furnance is need to progress into later parts of Immersive Engineering as it is the first step in producing Steel Ingots.

Make a solid 3x3x3 cube of Blast Bricks and click the center with an Engineer's Hammer to activate the multi-block structure.
The Kiln is a great way to make alloys for cheap. Make a 2x2 cube with the Kiln Bricks and click it with an Engineer's Hammer to activate the multi-block sturcture.

The Engineer's Workbench is used to craft certain items needed later on in the mod in addition to applying upgrades to certain items.

You can find blueprints in villages which are required to craft certain items. You can craft some blueprints as well!

Read more about the Engineer's Workbench in your Engineer's Manual.

Make some cool looking Wooden Posts and Wall Mounts so you have a nice place to put your Wire Relays.

Click the top of the post with an Engineer's Hammer to configure which side should have an off shoot.

Click and Shift Click a Wall Mount with an Engineer's Hammer to rotate and flip the mount.

The Improved Blast Furnace makes Steel much quicker and can automate the process. Make a solid 3x3x3 cube of Reinforced Blast Bricks and then place a Hopper on the very top center of the cube. Click the center while holding an Engineer's Hammer to activate the multi-block structure. 

Place the two Preheaters on the side of the Improved Blast Furnace to speed up the process of making Steel (rotate with the Engineer's Hammer). Hopper or Pipe raw materials like Iron and Coal Coke into the top and place a chest on the front and back at the base to automatically extract Steel and Slag.
The mod ColorfulWater does just what you think it would. Colored water does not mix with any other fluids when placed in the world. You can even use the glowing water as a light source!
The Skyhook can be used to travel across any type of Wire Coil from Immersive Engineering! Just click a Wire Connector with the Skyhook to zoom around.

The Rustic mod adds Pots, Barrels, and Cabinets as storage options. Hold shift and move the scroll wheel while holding a Pot to change its pattern! Placing a Cabinet on top of another one will convert it into a double Cabinet.

Time to start generating some Energy! Place a Kinetic Dynamo a few blocks off the ground then place the Water Wheel so it is connected to the side with a black circle. Place a Wire Connector on the Kinetic Dynamo and use Wire Coils to transfer the Energy it generates.

Place water source blocks with a bucket so that the water flows in a way that pushes the wheel. 

You can actually place up to 3 Water Wheels next to each other for every 1 Kinetic Dynamo to generate more power.
You can also make Windmills and connect them to a Kinetic Dynamo to generate Energy too!

Using your Engineer's Manual, place the following blocks to create the Immersive Engineering Crusher. Click the Light Engineering Block at the bottom on the wide side with your Engineer's Hammer to activate the multi-block structure.

This is a great way to double your ores or break down blocks and items into it's basic form.

Conveyors are a great and cool way to transport your items. After placing them use your Engineer's Hammer to rotate them. They will automatically insert items if placed in front of a chest. Hoppers will automatically place items onto conveyors if you wish to extract items from a chest.

Read your Engineer's Manual if you want to learn more about vertical conveyors and more!

Construct the Metal Press as shown in your Engineer's Manual and click the piston with you Engineer's Hammer to activate the mutil-block structure. Input power on the top,  use a Hopper to place items on the conveyors, and placea chest at the end to collect them. You can now press ingots or items into various forms depending on the mold you have on the piston head.

Metal Barrels can hold up to 12 buckets worth of one liquid and they hold that liquid even if you break the block. 

While you can use just a bucket to add or remove some liquid, using Fluid Pipes is much faster. Use an Engineer's Hammer to change the top of the Barrel between Input (Blue) and Output (Orange) mode. Placing a Fluid Pipe between fluid containers will slower transfer fluid but it is best to also use a Fluid Pump.

Place the Fluid Pump and connect a Wire Connector on top so it can recieve power. Then use an Engineer's Hammer to configure the sides to have at least 1 Input and 1 Output. Next place some fluid pipes so you suck fluid in on the Input sides and push the fluid out quickly on the Output sides.

Immersive Engineering also allows for interacting with fluid blocks in the world so check out your Engineer's Manual to learn more.

The Garden Cloche is an amazing tool for farming. 

Place a seed on the top and the respective block it needs to grow on the bottom of the Garden Cloche's menu in the 2 "glass" inventory slots.

Place a Wire Connector on the very top of the block to give it power.

Pipe in Water (and optionally some kind of fertilizer) at the bottom of the Cloche.

Place a chest, conveyor belts, or transfer pipes on the back of the glass portion of the block to extract it's output.
The Iron Lattice added by Rustic will connect to other lattices, iron chains, and solid blocks when placed. Clicking an Iron Lattice while holding a leaf block will give the lattice a leafy look.
No time to explain! Quick, craft a Glass Cutter and cut an Ender Pearl into 8 shards!

Build an Excavator and find a way to power it (Look into the Biodiesel Generators in your Manual, make a lot of Water/Wind Mills, or use another mod).

Be sure to read up on Excavators in your Engineer's Manual to learn how to construct and run it.

Redstone Resonating Crystals are the basis for many things in Extra Utilities 2. You can get them as a rare drop from mining Redstone Ore or craft them using Redstone Dust and Ender Shards.

Okay now there is time to explain. Use those 8 Ender Shards you made in the last quest to craft 8 Redstone Resonating Crytals.
Find some Immersive Engineering Hemp Seeds by breaking tall grass and make some functional and decorative products out of Hemp!

The Charging Station is a block that accepts energy/power through various means like Wire Connectors and Coils. It can then charge items that store energy by clicking the Charging Station with the item you want to charge in your hand.

Scannable is a mod that adds the ability to scan for blocks and enitites in the world. It uses Modules to determine what the Scanner should scan for.

Shift Right Click while holding the Scanner to change which Modules are active and then hold Right Click to prepare a scan.

Make some of the more helpful Scannable Modules.

Use a Capacitor Backpack from Immersive Engineering to charge items in your inventory! Charge it in the Charging Station.

Craft a Core Sample Drill and supply it with power. Right click it to take a sample of the ground below. Use your Engineer's Manual to figure out what kind of Mineral Deposit you are looking for so you know where you want to drill. Move the Core Sample Drill around until you get the sample you are looking for.

Grid Power (from here on referred to as GP) is the Power System used exclusively by Extra Utilities 2. The way it works is very different from other traditional power/energy systems like Redstone Flux (RF). 

GP does not require wires of any kind. It is like magic in the sense that energy will flow from generators to machines/items that need GP automatically. GP is tied to the player so you can't share it with anyone else. If you are trying to use more GP than you are generating all of your GP machines/items will stop working!

You can always look at blocks or items that generate or use GP to see how much you are producing total and how much the thing you are looking at is generating or using.

OKAY, with that out of the way it's time to start generating and using GP! Craft a Resonator (a machine that crafts items using GP) and a Manual Mill (the most basic form of GP generation).

Place some Polished Stone in a Resonator and turn the Manual Mill to convert it into Stoneburnt. Then craft a Water Mill so you never have to use the Manual Mill again!

Place the Water Mill out of the way because as described before GP does not need wires. Place 2 Water source blocks diagonally to the Water Mill so flowing water touches all four sides of the Water Mill. Placing a Water source block so it is directly touching the side of the Water Mill does nothing.

If done correctly you should now be producing lots of GP constantly! I reccomend making at least 3 more Water Mills and setting them up as it is nice to just set them up and forget about GP for awhile.

Extra Utilities 2 adds some of the easiest to use pipes in all of modded Minecraft.

Just simply place a Transfer Node (Items) on a chest, machine, or anything that holds items and then place a line of Transfer Pipes from the node to another inventory to move items. 

Use a Transfer Node (Fluids) and Transfer Pipes in a similar fashion to move fluids!

Clicking on a Transfer Node will open it's menu to show you what block/fluid is currently being transfered, slots for upgrades, and a slot for a filter!

Click while holding a filter to edit it. Place what items you want to transfer through the node into the filter or switch it to a blacklist if you want to tell it what items to not transfer. Use buckets of fluids to set a fluid filter. After your filter is set place the filter in the transfer node.

Pro Tip: You can place filters inside of filters if you need more slots!

Use your Resonator to make three Upgrade Bases. Then craft one of each of the three basic upgrades for Extra Utilities Transfer Nodes and Machines. Transfer Nodes do not use any GP on their own but adding upgrades to them will start to cost some so make sure you have enough GP before adding your upgrades! 

Upgrade Speed increase the speed at which Machines works and how fast Transfer Nodes move items/fluids.

Upgrade Stack moves 1 stack of items at a time instead of just 1 item at a time.

Upgrade Mining allows Transfer Node (Items) to transfer infinite Cobblestone if the node is placed on a block of Cobblestone that is touching both a Water and Lava source block. It also allows Transfer Node (Fluids) to transfer infinite water if it is placed on a Water source block that is also touching two more Water source blocks.
A very useful block that breaks blocks in front of it.
A very useful block if you want to automatically craft one item over and over again. Just set the crafting grid the way you want it and then place the resources in the inventory.

A very useful block that acts like a player clicking on the block in front of it. You can configure it to use right or left click in addition to clicking on a block or using an item on a block. You can place items in the inventory if you want to simulate a player clicking an item onto a block (like clicking bonemeal onto a crop).
The Golden Lasso can be used to pick up any passive mob! Just click them with the Lasso in hand and they are stored in the Lasso. Click the Lasso on a block to place the mob back down.

There are A LOT of RF generation options added by Extra Utilities 2. You should make a Culinary Generator as providing fuel for it is easy to do with a good farm and it converts just about any food source into RF. Explore JEI for what foods are best to use for RF generation in terms of speed and quantity.

If you place an RF Battery next to any type of RF generator and then place an RF Transmitter on top of the Battery any machines nearby (within 4 blocks) will recieve 80 RF/t. This does require some GP in order to work. Not great for long distances but nice if you don't want to run wires in a room full of machines.
Tired of seeing all of those ways to get items by using a Crusher in JEI? Then make yourself a nice Crusher!

The Chicken and Squid Ring are cool and all but let's skip to what we really want. The Angel Ring provides the player with creative flight if they are generating enough GP. You can craft different types of rings to give your player various wings if you desire but for this quest just make the basic ring as it is easy to craft it into the other rings.

AFTER YOU HAVE COMPLETED THIS QUEST, you can place your ring into a crafting interface to craft your ring into a Bauble which will let you place it in one of your Bauble slots. Access your Bauble slots by clicking the little circle to the top right of your player model in your inventory screen.
The Angel Block can be placed without looking at any other block. This is very nice when you want to build a floating island-like base but don't want to have to pillar up to start making it.
Sick of having to use those coal hungry slow Vanilla furnaces? Make an Extra Utilities 2 Furnace which runs on RF and can be upgraded with Speed Upgrades!
Want to use RF instead of levels to enchant things? Well now you can! You can also use the Enchanter to make certain materials you can't get any other way. Check out JEI to learn more.

The Chunk Loading Ward will load an area of 3x3 chunks around it so crops will continue to grow and machines will keep running even if you are not around. 

In order to craft the Chunk Loading Ward you can't just use any Villager in a Lasso. The Villager has to be willing to do it so you must craft a Contract and click on a Villager for them to sign it. Their response will be on the right of the menu when you click on them. If they say yes (most say no) there will be a "Sign" button that you can click. Once the Villager has signed the Contract you can pick them up with a Lasso and craft your Chunk Loading Ward. 

With great power comes great responsibility. Chunk loading can cause a lot of lag if abused. Only use a Chunk loader if the chunks you are loading contain a minimal amount of machines and entities.
While Extra Utilities 2 uses GP for some things it also uses RF for more basic machines. Craft the Furnace Generator so you can generate some RF using various burnable fuels.

Once you have the means, craft a Dragon Egg Mill and get yourself a Dragon Egg. Place the Mill down and then place the Egg on top to generate an extra 500 GP!

Pro Tip: Dragon Eggs spawn on the top of the End Portal in The End after slaying the dragon. Trying to break a Dragon Egg with a Pickaxe will cause it to teleport a few blocks away. Instead place a Piston down next to it and power the piston so it pushes the Egg. This will cause it to drop in its item form. It might fall in the End Portal so go through and grab it or catch it before it falls!

If you want to transfer Items or Fluids from one inventory to another but the two inventories are directly next to each other you can use Flat Transfer Nodes to save space! They can be placed in between blocks that are touching each other!
It's like a regular Upgrade Speed, but magical!
It's like a Magical Speed Upgrade, but ultimatey!

The indexer is a block that can be connected to various chests and inventories using Transfer Pipes (no nodes needed). It uses GP to make looking in a lots of chests easy!

When you open the menu, the top section is all of the items that are connected to the indexer, the second section is the item buffer that will be used when requesting items from chests, and the last section is to send items from the Indexer into an inventory (this requires you to place a transfer node on the indexer and connect it to at least one inventory).
After crafting an Indexer Remote, click an Indexer to pair it. You can now use that Indexer even when you are far away!

The first step in creating the Portal to Alfheim is crafting all the blocks.

Next see the Lexica Botania section Alfhomancy -> Portal to Alfheim to see the image of how to construct the Portal.

The Portal requires a lot of Mana to initially open but only requires a small amount of constant Mana to keep it open. To activate the Portal simply right click the Core with the Wand of the Forest.

Pro Tip: Drop you Lexica into the portal to unlock more entries.

Now that your TAP is set up drop a single mannasteel ingot, mana diamond, and mana pearl onto the plate. The infusion process will create a Terrasteel ingot at the cost of about half a Mana Pool. If you pick up one of the items while the process is ongoing you will cancel the infusion and lose any Mana that was already consumed.

The Petal Apothecary is used to create the various generating and functional flora in Botania. 

Click the Apothecary with a Bucket of Water, drop (Press Q) a Bucket of Water, or pipe in Water to fill the Apothecary to prepare it for use. 

Then while holding petals press Q to drop them into the Apothecary and when a recipe is ready finish it by dropping a seed into the Apothecary. 

Use JEI or your Lexica to find recipes.
For more specific and in depth help you can use Botania's in game book the Lexica Botania. This will outline the whole mod while the quests will guide you through the main aspects.
Terrasteel Armor acts in the same way manasteel armor acts. It uses mana instead of taking damage however has the same strength as diamond instead of iron.

Botania has a wide range of flowers that can be made. They can do many things from powering furnaces to damaging mobs. To find out what other flowers can do and how to create them look in the Lexica Botania under functional flora.

Botania adds 16 Mystical Flowers throughout the world. You need them all at some point to progress further but the White Mystical Flower is the most important to get started in Botania. 

If you don't feel like exploring the world you can also use Floral Fertilizer on grass to grow Mystical Flowers!

Pro Tip: After you find one color of Mystical Flower you can farm it. Put it in a crafting table to turn it into petal then plant the petal on grass. Bonemeal the shimmering petal to turn it into a Tall Mystical Flower. YOU NEED SHEARS to harvest Tall Mystical Flowers, punching it with your hand will not work. This is an easy way to get a lot of the same type of Mystical Flower.

The Pure Daisy is one of the most important flowers in Botania. Placing Stone and Wood Logs in the 8 blocks around a Pure Daisy will purify them into Livingrock and Livingwood. The process takes about 60 seconds. Livingrock and Livingwood are used in a lot of Botania recipes.

Mana is a magicial source of energy. It is like RF but magicial and only works with Botania. There is a set of generating flowers that you can use to create Mana, each with there own strengths and weaknesses. The most basic is the Endoflame. Simply drop any fuel you would use in a furnace and this flower will use it to generate Mana.

Moving Mana around from flowers to blocks or vice versa is very important in Botania. To do this you will need a Mana Spreader. Use your Wand of the Forest and shift right click a generating flower then shift right click a Mana Spreader to transfer the Mana from the flower to the Spreader.

Also you can use your Wand of the Forest to shift right click the Spreader and then shift right click another block to send Mana from the Spreader to the block.

Some tools/items from Botania will require you to have a portable source of Mana, enter the Mana Tablet. To put mana into it shift right click on a Mana Pool with the Wand of the Forest to change it between input and output mode, then drop the tablet on top and it should start to drain the pool and fill up the tablet.
Now that you can generate and move Mana you can store it in a Mana Pool! Link up your generating flora to send to a Mana Spreader and then link your Spreader to send to your Mana Pool.

Sparks are kinda like Mana Spreaders. Place a Spark on top of a Mana Pool and then place another Spark above a block that needs Mana and assuming they are close enough the block will be able to use the Mana from the Mana Pool.

To create Terrasteel you need to make the Terrastrial Agglomeration Plate (referred to as TAP). After you have created the TAP you have to place it onto a 3x3 checkerboard pattern of Lapis Lazuli Blocks and Livingrock (See Lexica Botania for image). The TAP requires a large amount of Mana so place a Spark above it near a Mana Pool with a Spark so it can quickly get what it needs.

As you move on in Botania and create more complex items and flowers you will need runes. 

You craft runes by placing items on a Runic Altar, sending Mana to the Alter, and then start the process by putting a piece of Livingrock on the Alter and clicking it with your Wand of the Forest.

To put items onto it right click the altar with the item in your hand or drop it onto the Alter. To remove items shift right click with an empty hand.

The terra blade is a sword that has the same strength as a diamond sword and also repairs with mana. The main feature of the sword is when swung there is a chance that it will create a beam that deals as much damage as a melee hit. This means that you can damage mobs/players at a distance.
Now that you have portable mana storage you may want to make mana steel tools or armour. This will be repaired by the mana in the mana tablet when the tools or armour are damaged.

The Terra Shatterer is a tool that can take in mana in the same way that a mana tablet can however it can not give the mana back. The tool uses the mana to rank up as it advances from rank to rank it will be able to break a larger area. You can change the tools ability by right clicking.

The Wand of the Forest is like a magical wrench. It is used to interact with blocks and flowers in Botania to configure them in a specific way. You should read up on how the Wand works in your Lexcia.

Now you have created the main parts to the portal you have to construct it to do this see the Lexica Botania under Alfhomancy then Portal to Alfheim. The portal requires a substantial amount of mana to initially open however doesn't cost a big amount to keep open. To open the portal simply right click the core with the wand of the forest. Also before you try the portal also only allows items to be sent through it however the Elves seem happy to trade their items your yours.

If you are playing on Peaceful I have added a recipe for Gaia Spirits that requies a beacon and 4 Gaia Pylons. 

If you are playing on survival, to get Gaia Spirits you will need to perform the Ritual of Gaia and slay the Gaia. You require an active beacon (you can use the smallest pyramid), some gaia pylons and a single terrasteel ingot to perform the Ritual. 

The ritual will summon the Gaia Guardian which is much stronger than the Wither and if you are successful in killing the Gaia it will drop some Spirits of the Gaia. Use your Lexica to see how to setup the Ritual.

Botania has one of the best in-game guidebooks in all of modded Minecraft. This questline will give helpful tips here and there but the Lexica Botania will be required reading to progress in the mod. Go to the Lexicon Index section and use the search tool to quickly find a specific page!

The Terra Shatterer is a tool that can take in Mana like a Mana Tablet however it can not output Mana. The tool uses the Mana to rank up as it advances from rank to rank it will be able to break a larger area. You can change the tools ability by right clicking.
The Flower Pouch is a very useful item that holds

The Gourmaryllis is a generating flora similar to the Endoflame but instead of using fuel you would use in a furnace, this flora uses food as a source of generating Mana. Check out your Lexica for the nitty gritty details of how this flower works!

If you place an Alchemical Catalyst directly underneath a Mana Pool you will be able to convert various items into others using Mana!  

This is a great way to convert saplings into others or a quick way to get ice!

Pasture Seeds are created by dropping Tall Grass into a Mana Pool. When a Pasture Seed is placed on Dirt, it will convert it to Grass and spread to nearby Dirt like wild fire. This is much quicker and more fun than watching Grass grow normally!

You can also convert Pasture Seeds into 5 other types of seeds that grow Podzol, Mycelium, and more! Check your Lexica to learn more.

It is possible to attach a flower to a piece of Dirt with a Pasture Seed, making it into a Floating Flower! These are great for decoration or for builds that require a functional/generating flower to be placed in the air!

The Rod of the Lands places Dirt at the cost of Mana

The Rod of the Depths places Cobblestone at the cost of Mana

The Rod of the Seas places Water source blocks at the cost of Mana

Make sure you have some source of Mana in your inventory like a Mana Tablet to use these helpful Rods!

The Rod of the Shifting Crust is a very helpful tool that can be used to swap out blocks in the world with ones you have in your inventory! Building with this item saves so much time! Read up about the specifics of this awesome item in your Lexica!

Botania adds a lot of Baubles. Baubles are little charms like rings, necklaces, and more that you can wear! Click the little circle to the top right of your player model in your inventory to see your Bauble slots!

You can use the Bauble Case to store both your Mana Tablet and Baubles for quick access! Some Baubles are purely cosmetic like the ones in this quest while others have amazing abilities like in the next quest!

These three Baubles are very helpful to have on you at all times! 

The Band of Aura will slowly generate Mana out of thin air and fill any Mana holding items in your inventory.

The Band of Mana is like a Mana Tablet but it fits in your Bauble slots!

The Soujourner's Sash allows you to walk up 1 block high heights like they were stairs and give you a speed buff!

The Orechid is a functional flora that converts nearby Stone blocks into a random Overworld ore at the cost of Mana. It is possible to automate this flower so you have a quarry that makes and mines ore right in your home!

There is another type of Orechid that does the same thing but with Netherrack and Nether ores.

The Astral Tome can be a bit cryptic at times but is an amazing resource. As you progress through Astral Sorcery, by crafting key items, you will unlock more chapters in your Astral Tome.

The Tome contains invaluable information regarding multiblock structures you will be required to build in addition to important notes about Constellations in the night sky.

Pro Tip: While you can hover over a galaxy (chapter) in your Astral Tome and use your scroll wheel to zoom in/out, you can also just double click on a galaxy to instantly zoom in. Switch between tabs on the top right of the book to quickly zoom out.

There are 4 types of Ancient Shrines that generate naturally throughout the world listed below. They are all constructed of Marble type blocks and decorated with Sea Laterns and Water. It would be wise of you to collect as much Marble material as you can when you find these structures as they are an important part of Astral Sorcery.

1. Basic Foutains (Found in various biomes): Explorers will often find hidden chests beneath the Marble Pillars that contain valuable Constellation Papers and materials.
2. Underground Shrines (Found in caves): Mining the stone block at the center of the room repeatedly has a chance of it being replaced with an ore!
3. Buried Shrines (Found in Deserts): These shrines contain Floating Crystals which are required to start Astral Sorcery.
4. Large Shrines (Found in Extreme Hills): These are the most ornate structures of all and also contain the precious Floating Crystals.

Found in the Shrines described in the previous quest, these papers are needed in order to learn more about constellations in the mod. You can shift right click while holding your Tome to store them for easy access. 

There are 5 major constellations and 7 minor ones. You will have trouble finding or seeing the minor ones until later on in the mod but it is vital that you find the papers for the 5 major constellations as early as you can.

The first big step to dive into Astral Sorcery is placing a Crafting Table near a Floating Crystal which you can find in some Ancient Shrines.

The energy emitted by the Floating Crystal should begin to flow towards the Crafting Table which will unlock the ability to craft 2 important items, the Resonating Wand and the Luminous Crafting Table. The Luminous Crafting Table is used to craft special items from the mod by harnessing Starlight.

Depending on where you place the table and what time it is will determine how filled the Starlight bar will be. When you want to craft an item place them in the grid and then click the table with your Resonating Wand to begin the craft. Placing the Luminous crafting table high up and waiting until midnight is the best way to maximize Starlight early on. Placing the table higher than y level 120 will no longer effect on how much Starlight it can harness. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Many things in Astral Sorcery need direct visibilty to the night sky! If you ever feel like you are doing everything right in this mod and you do not expierence the correct outcome try using a Hammock from the mod Comforts to take a nap until night time and then break any blocks that might be blocking direct moonlight from important crystals, tables, or altars.

If you hold your Resonating Wand in your hand at night and go exploring, it will reveal to you areas where Rock Crystal Ore is buried deep below. I reccomend marking multiple areas on your map where you find the white light on the surface and then safely dig down to bedrock level to mine all the ore at once.

Rock Crystals are used a lot in this mod so be sure to get a lot of them!

By placing Rock Crystals in a Lightwell you will extract the stored energy from the crystal in the form of Liquid Starlight. The amount of liquid you can extract varies and the Rock Crystal will eventually break. The Lightwell can only hold 2 buckets worth of liquid and if a well is full any extra liquid extracted will go to waste so be sure to stay on top of emptying your wells with buckets. 

You can also use Aquamarine in a Lightwell to get Liquid Starlight but you get significantly less than using Rock Crystals. Also if you wish to pipe out liquids from the Lightwell you can do so from its bottom face.

Each Rock Crystal has the three traits Size, Purity, and Cutting. The the higher the number the better.

Size: The grindability and general durability of the crystal
Purity: The power of the starlight contained within
Cutting: The determining factor for damage or tool speed if the crystal is used for a weapon/tool.

By taking a bucket of Liquid Starlight and placing it on the ground you can drop a Rock Crystal in the liquid and overtime it will increase its Size but it will also decrease its Cutting. If a crystal has high enough stats and soaks in the liquid long enough it will split into multiple crystals and there will be a chance one will have a higher Purity!!

If you place a bucket of Liquid Starlight in the world and then drop a Rock Crystal and a Stardust into the liquid it will begin the process of converting the Rock Crystal into a Celestial Crystal!

The Cluster takes time to grow but you know it is done growing when it emits white partical effects, when that happens just break the Cluster with a pickaxe. Celestial Crystals are identical to Rock Crystals in every way except their max Size stat is 900 and they are blue.

Illumination Powder can be placed (and even thrown!) and will emit light. In order to remove them simple place and break a block where they sit. 

Once placed, the Cave Illuminator will slowly over time place Illumination Powders in nearby caves. After giving it many in game days to work its magic you can break the Cave Illuminator and the Illumination Powder it places will stick around forever unless you decide to remove them manually.

The Spectral Relay is a block that is used often in Astral Sorcery. One of the best uses early on is to focus more Starlight into your Luminous Crafting Table.

By placing the relay on a small 3x3 multiblock structure of Marble materials (see Exploration chapter in Tome) and placing a Glass Lens in the relay will give any nearby Luminous Crafting Tables access to more Starlight, even in the daytime! But be careful too many of these setup will have a negative effect.

If you ever struggle with getting enough base Starlight in your Luminous Crafting Table (or Altars later on) you can use the Fosic Resonator at night to find areas with high concentrations of natural Starlight.

Exploring the surface at night while holding the resonator will reveal a blue starry fog. The thicker the fog, the more Starlight a block like the Luminous Crafting Table will recieve it is placed there.

By using the Looking Glass at night and scanning the sky for unqiue arragements of stars you can discover more about Constellations!

Look around for sets of stars that seem to move differently then the others, almost like they are jumping out at you. Once you find them try to bring them all into a clear view and press shift. This will bring your cursor on screen and you can connect the stars together by clicking and dragging you mouse. Be sure to study the Constellations in your book (Constellations tab in the top right) so you can recognize them come night time. 

If you mess up just stop using your Looking Glass for a second but be sure not to move where you or looking or you might have to find the stars again! The Constellations that are visable change each night so go star gazing as often as possible.

The next big step in Astral Sorcery! After performing the craft (at night time and with ample Starlight) your Luminous Crafting Table will transform into a Starlight Crafting Altar.

In order to use it though you will need to build a fairly large multiblock structure which you can find in your Tome.

Pro Tip: Now is a good time find the best spot to place the table in regard to Starlight access. Use your Fosic Resonator and mark the best spot you can find. Placing it near a Floating Crystal is a smart idea and giving your self room to expand the multiblock is also a must! Later altars require more room.

By placing either a Rock Crystal or a Crystal Tool on a Grindstone and clicking you will increase the Cutting but lower the Size. Be sure to check the stats often because it is possible to grind too much off and make the stats worse overall.

Crystal Tools stats work the same way as Rock Crystals in that they can soak in Liquid Starlight and be used on a Grindstone.

The higher the Purity the less Size will be lost from using the Grindstone. By switching between soaking in Liquid Starlight and using the Grindstone, Rock Crystals can get max Size and Cutting. The only way to get max Purity is to have the Crystal split into multiple while soaking and hope for the best!

The Celestial Gateway (see Tome for multiblock structure) is a teleport pad that works across dimensions. After you set one up at your base, try going to The End to set one up (or the Nether if it is safer). 

After you have two gateways created, you can stand directly on top of one and you will become surrounded by a what appears to be a night sky. The bright golden stars are your other Gateways and you can focus on them and click to teleport!

The Formation Wand will place blocks from the player's inventory in a long straight line from a far distance, much greater than the base reach of a player. 

The Conversion Wand will convert/exchange blocks that have been placed in the world with another block from the player's inventory.

To select the block that will be used to place or exchange just place it in the world and shift click it while holding a wand.

Xtones is a futuristic block decoration mod. It is similar to chisel but instead of a chisel item to convert blocks, you simple hold the item in your hand and press shift while scrolling to change the block between types.

The Telescope is similar to the Looking Glass but it makes it easier to see the night sky as it divides them up into sections allowing you to rotate through them with arrows on the sides of the interface. 

The stars of a Constellation might not jump out at you like before with the Looking Glass but if you look closely Constellations are made of up of stars that are a just a bit bigger than the rest.

The Telescope is also needed in order to find the minor constellations but that is covered later on in a different quest.

The Implusion Wand is like a magical grappling hook. Simply click it once (no need to hold down click) to fire off an orb in the direction you are aiming. If it comes into contact with a block it will pull the player towards it. 

It is best used for climbing up mountains or out of caves but its horizontal movement can be quite impressive once mastered.

The Linking Tool is like the wrench of Astral Sorcery. It is used to connect two blocks and will be used in the next two quests in addition to the rest of the mod!

In the meantime, did you know that if you link a Floating Crystal to a Lightwell it will extract the Liquid Starlight from an item faster?

The Attunement Altar is the key for unlocking Astral Sorcery's end game content. It requires a very large multiblock structure which you can find in your Tome. You know it is set up correctly when you can see partical effects.

I reccommend reading the chapter about Attunement in your Tome but I will write a short list on how to Attune yourself to a certain Constellation:

1. Setup the multiblock and place your Attunement Altar.
2. Hold the Constellation Paper of the Constellation you want to Attune yourself to in your off hand/shield slot.
3. If that Constellation is in the sky at night, blue fog will emit from blocks around the altar while holding the Constellation Paper.
4. Place Spectral Relays on the block with the blue fog.
5. Once the Constellation is drawn on the ground by connecting the relays stand on the pedestal to Attune yourself to that Constellation (you can also drop a Rock/Celestial Crystal on the Altar to attune the Crystal).

After Attuning yourself you will now be able to discover the 7 Minor Constellations from Constellation Paper which in turn will allow you to discover them in the sky.

The mod Inspirations adds a ton of little things to modded Minecraft and tweaks a few things from vanilla Minecraft.

One of the awesome things it adds is various types of path tile blocks. These look great in a garden or for a village path.
Apiaries with Bees in them will cause plants nearby to grow faster. The more Bees the better as plants will grow faster and the Bees will produce more Honeycombs.

The Ritual Pedastel (see Tome for multiblock structure) is similar to a vanilla style beacon. After the pedastel is setup place an Attuned Rock or Celestial Crystal on it. The Constellation the Crystal is Attuned to will determine the effect it gives off.

The size of the Crystal will make the ritual more effective and the purity will determine the rituals range. 

While you can only Attune yourself to one of the 5 major Constellations, you can Attune Crystals to any Constellation, major or minor.

If you ever want to completely reset the Constellation you are Attuned to you can use the Shifiting Star.

While holding it, fire it like a bow to remove you levels, perks, and current Attunement. After doing this you will be able to Attune yourself to any of the 5 major Constellations again.

Now that you are Attuned you will have a new Tab in your Tome titled Perks. This will show you your current level and perk tree for your Attunement. 

You can only Attune yourself to one Constellation at a time and you can only Attune yourself to one of the 5 major Constellations. Also note that 1 of the 7 minor Constellations (which you can now discover if you are Attuned) only shows up the night after a solar eclipse which happens 1 in every 36 Minecraft days.

The Constellation you Attuned yourself to will determine how you level up and what perk tree you get. Here is a quick list of how to level up with each Constellation Attunement:

Discidia -> Deal Damage
Armara -> Take Damage
Aevitas -> Be near things that grow (Crops, Sapling, etc.)
Evorsio -> Break Blocks
Vicio -> Walk, Run, Jump, Swim, etc.

Just like when creating the Starlight Crafting Altar, place the required ingrediants in your Altar and provide it with enough Starlight to begin the conversion of your Starlight Crafting Altar into a Celestial Altar.

After the conversion finishes be sure to look into your Tome to see how you need to upgrade the multiblock structure to work with your new Altar.

After crafting and setting up your Starlight Infuser (see Tome for multiblock structure) you are ready to start infusing all the things! Just place a valid item in the Infuser and click the Infuser with your Resonating Wand.

Infusing something with the Starlight Infuser will most likely consume some (and maybe all) of the Liquid Starlight that is placed around it. So in order to infuse something be sure all of the 12 blocks around the Infuser are filled with Liquid Starlight source blocks.
Chandelier Rings need to be hung from a Chain and then you can place Laterns or Candles made from your Bees to add some rustic lighting to your base.

You can Infuse all the Crystal Tools to unlock a hidden power.

Infuse a Crystal Sword to add an Area of Effect attack

Infuse a Crystal Axe to chop down multiple trees at once

Infuse a Crystal Shovel to break large areas of blocks

Infuse a Crystal Pickaxe to give it the right click ability to see ores through blocks!
Simply place an Aquamarine in your Starlight Infuser to infuse it into a Resonating Gem.

Lenses are used like repeaters in that they extend the reach of Starlight from a Floating Crystal. Try to link a Floating Crystal to a Lens and then link the Lens to your Starlight Altar to increase its Starlight!

Note: The Rock Crystal you use to make your Lens is important. The Purity determines how much Starlight your Lens can transfer and the Size determines how many Lenses you make in a single craft!

Now that you have a Linking Tool you can begin using Starlight to Transmute blocks! Place some Iron Ore near a Floating Crystal and link the two together. Give the Starlight enough time to work its magic and soon you will have Starmetal Ore!

Smelt the ore in a furnace to get an ingot and then grind that ingot on a Grindstone to turn it into Stardust.

Tip: There are more blocks then just Iron Ore that you can Transmute. Here is the conversion list:

Iron Ore -> Starmetal Ore
Magma Block -> Obsidian
Sand -> Clay
Diamond Ore -> Emerald Ore
Netherwart Block -> Soul Sand
Sea Lantern -> Block of Lapis
Sandstone -> Endstone
Netherrack -> Netherbrick
Pumpkin -> Cake

The Spectral Lens allows you to upgrade a regular Lens to grant it the ability to transfer Starlight beams through blocks! This is very nice when you do not have direct line fo sight of the block you wish to send Starlight to.

Just click a placed Lens while holding a Spectral Lens to place the Spectral Lens on it. Shift right click the Lens to remove it.
