There are six types of Colored Lenses that when placed on a Lens will give the beam of Starlight a unique effect. These are very useful utilities like breaking blocks, pushing mobs, and restoring lost hearts!
The PrismLens acts just like a regular Lens but it allows you to split the beam of Starlight that enters it. So you can link a PrismLens to multiple targets!

The Ritual Pedastel is a great tool but is limited by its lack of mobility. Placing one Ritual Anchor 5 blocks above the Pedastel and then placing another Anchor far away will allow you to change the location of the effect the Ritual gives off. You will need to use your Linking Tool to link the two Ritual Anchors together.

Now that you have Collector Crystals you can also increase the potency of your Rituals. Link a Collector Crystal to a Ritual Pedastel and you will notice refracted beams of Starlight shoot off. Place Lenses where the refracted beams end to reflect the Starlight back at the Pedastel.

Collector Crystals (and the Celestial variant) act just like Floating Crystals that you find in Ancient Shrines but can be crafted by the player and freely moved around.

In order to craft one you must use an Attuned Rock/Celestial Crystal.

Once created you can create a multiblock structure (see the Constellations chapter/galaxy in your Tome) to vastly increase the Starlight avaliable to your Altar, even during the day!

At first glance this wand does not seem very special. Sure it provides the player with an unlimited light source (click on a block to place an Illumination Powder). But more importantly you can shift right click a block to make it transparent, a light source, and unbreakable.

You can also combine the wand with a dye to change the color of the Illumination Powder that it places!

While there are easier ways to make tree farms in this pack I think it is important to showcase this awesome way to make a tree farm.

Place a Tree Beacon down and then place 2 to 3 saplings nearby. After the trees grow they will become transparent and slowly overtime drop tree related items (logs, apples, saplings, etc.) until they eventually disappear completely.

If you link a Crystal to the Beacon it will increase the speed of the process greatly. Trying to automate this process is a fun challenge.

The Iridescent Altar is similar to the Celestial Altar but has two key differences. After upgrading your multiblock structure, some recipes will require you to place Spectral Relays on the Sooty Marble near your Altar for holding extra ingredients (these are the ones that float/rotate around the grid when viewing recipes).

After starting a crafting recipe each Relay will display what ingredient is reqiured to finish the craft one at a time. I suggest placing 5 or so Spectral Relays around your Altar before starting any crafts. 

The other key difference to this Altar is that it has a spot for an Attuned Crystal which might be required to unlock certain recipes.

The Stellar Refraction table is used to attain very powerful potions and enchantments not possible in vanilla. With a clear line a sight to the night sky, place your Parchment and Infused Glass in the table. Click and drag 3 Constellations onto the Parchment in an attempt to engrave the glass. It is possible it will fail a lot but keep trying. Once the glass is engraved you can place a bottle of water, tool, armor, or book under the glass in the table to brew/enchant. 

The Constellations you choose and the number you use of each one will determine what effects the Engraved Glass will have. The Constellations that you are allowed to use is determined by if that Constellation can be seen in the sky that night.

This upgraded Resonator adds another mode (switch between them by shift clicking while holding) that when held at night time will reveal bodies of liquid deep below the surface. This bodies of liquid cannot be attained by manually searching for them though, you will need to use a special magical contraption for that.

The Containment Chalice is a liquid holding block that can store 24 buckets of liquid. You can input or extract liquids from the bottom face or just use a bucket.

Chalices that are placed close together will interact with each other if they contain two liquids that interact. For example placing down two Chalices and filling one with Lava and one with Liquid Starlight will interact and drop Sand and (more rarely) Aquamarine Shale! Other liquids that interact are Lava and Water in addition to Liquid Starlight and Water.

Chalices will automatically pull Liquid Starlight from nearby Lightwells.

After finding a good spot to place your Evershifting Fountain with your upgraded Resonator, make the multiblock structure shown in your Tome. 

Place your Neromatic Prime directly underneath the Evershifting Fountain and then place a Containment Chalice directly on top of the Evershifting Fountain.

Put Liquid Starlight in the Containment Chalice to start the process.

It would be wise to place down 2 extra Containment Chalices nearby to collect any liquids collected by the fountain. 

If you place any blocks within the multiblock structure it will disable the fountain.

It is possible to Attune your Resonating Wand to one of the five major Constellations in your new Altar! 

Each one has it's own unique effect so check out your Tome to learn more.

The Mantle of the Stars is an amazing chestpiece that is highly enchantable. It can also be attuned with any Constellation to give the wearer a unique ability. Check the Constellations Tab and scroll to the last page of each Constellation to learn more.

You will need an Attuned Crystal in your Altar in order to craft this item. After it is crafted you can perform another craft with it to change what Constellation it is Attuned to if you so desire.
Fertile Soil acts just like regular tilled dirt but it doesn't need a water source block nearby to keep it hydrated and you can grow Sugar Cane on them!

You can get Grape Seeds by breaking Vines so find a Swamp or Jungle to forage them quickly. After being planted, Grapes require horizontal Rope to be directly above them in order to spread their grape vines. Craft some Rope and place them just like you would string.
Wildberry Bushes can be find throughout the world and after being relocated have a chance to grow another bush nearby!
Ironwood Leaves have a small chance of dropping Ironberries when broken. Find a tree out in the world and get a sapling from it so you can begin farming it back at your base.

Use the Crushing Tub by placing crushable items like Grapes, Ironberries, and Wildberries into the tub. Then stand on top of the tub and jump up and down to crush 1 item into liquid. Use a bucket to pull the freshly crushed juice out of the tub (assuming you have at least a buckets worth in there).
Place your Ironberry Juice in a drying basin and slowly overtime it will evaporate into Tiny Piles of Iron Dust which you can turn into Iron Ingots! You can now grow Iron!
Now that you have juices you can start brewing some special beverages. Checkout the Almanac to learn how to make the best brews.

Go explore this really cool magic-tech (that has a magic skin) mod! For those that don't know Psi normally has a very techy look (like guns instead of wands) but this pack contains Magicial Psi which just changes the name and textures of the items to look more magical. 

Psi is all about creating your own spells by using a wide range of base actions. This mod has it's very own amazing tutorial so it doesn't have it's own questline in this book.

This quest is just here to get you started on the mod. First make the Rod Constructor and Spell Inscriber. Next craft an Iron Rod Frame and place it in the Rod Constructor to make the most basic of Focusing Rods. Now drop some Redstone Dust on the ground and click it with the Focusing Rod to turn it into Psidust! You've now unlocked Psi's tutorial. Just press the C key while not selecting your rod and click the little button in the bottom right of the Psi book to start the selected tutorial!

Core Root spawn in caves and Marsh Mallow Root spawn in Jungle and Swamp Biomes. There are many herbs added by Rustic that are used for things like making Elixirs. Once you have one type of herb you can plant it and farm it so you don't have to keep exploring for more of that type.
Using the two Herbs you collected earlier you can make a powerful Haste II Elixir! Look up the recipe in JEI for the specifics.

Place your Condenser down and then place the 3 Retorts on the left, right, and back of the Condenser. If you placed everything correctly clicking the Condenser should open the menu. You can now create advanced Elixirs!

Welcome to Refined Storage! 
-Now have the option of a mass stoage system for the pack!
-Store all your items on the grid and even craft remotely.
-Your going to need a static source of power to keep it running.
-Questline will cover some of the basics and move towards advaced options.
-Hope you enjoy this Questing addition! ~C

Your going to want to have a good amount of iron, nether quartz, silicon, and glass to begin your quest.

To get started, Craft the cutting tool to begin working with Refined Storage.
Make Basic Chips with the cutting tool.
Making some progess this will help
Diamond cutting required. Almost to the core of things!

Your goning to need some network cable to connect the equipement. Cable will also be required to make some of the other items in this mod. Grab some quartz enriched iron, stained glass, and redstone to get started.

Going to need these cores for the Grid to build items up or break them down.
-A trip to the nether maybe required for some of that cool glowing stone and quartz crystals!

betterquesting:10.name:8: Getting to the core of things
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The RS network controller is the heart of your storage network grid. Its going to need some power though.
-Once you got it juiced up, click on it and it will give you the power usage and componets of your RS grid.
-Complete this quest to gain some XP and earn some basic storage space to get you started. (click right arrow below next to claim)
-Only one Controller per network though is all you need!
Quartz enriched iron is the main metal used in Refined Storage. Your going to need alot of Nether Quartz and iron to make this special alloy.
RS wrench to help you manipulate your componets.

Cook up the basic cut chips to make the processor
-These processors form the basis of many componets in the RS Grid.

Bake the cut improved chip to make full improved processors!
-Use these processors to upgrade your storage and make advanced equipment for the grid.
-If only there were a large source of Gold?

Cook up your cut advanced chips to make the Advanced Processor.
-These advanced processors will be required to make screens, larger capacity storage, and other componets to complete your grid system. 
-Get some Diamonds ready!

The Constructor places items or fluids from the storage network in the world.

No other blocks can be in front of the Constructor (except fluids) and it should be possible for the block to be placed (for example: saplings need dirt).

The Constructor can also drop items in the world instead of placing actual blocks. When provided with a Stack Upgrade, it'll drop stacks of items at a time.

Applicable upgrades:

-Speed Upgrade
-Fortune Upgrade
-Silk Touch Upgrade

The Destructor destroys blocks or fluids in front of it and puts the drops in the storage network.

The Destructor has the ability to only break certain blocks or fluids, with the whitelist and blacklist option. Said whitelist and blacklist can be NBT or damage sensitive.

The Destructor can also pick up items in the world instead of destroying blocks.

Applicable upgrades:

-Speed Upgrade
-Fortune Upgrade
-Silk Touch Upgrade

The Importer imports items or fluids from an inventory in front of the block and inserts it in the storage network (if there is space).

By default, it will import all accessible slots (place the Importer on the correct side, where the slot or fluid tank is reachable) but the player can use the whitelist or blacklist as well.
Whitelist and blacklist

There is also a whitelist and blacklist option to only allow or forbid some items from entering the storage network.

The whitelist or blacklist can be configured to be NBT or damage sensitive.
Applicable upgrades

-Speed Upgrade
-Stack Upgrade

The Exporter extracts items or fluids from the storage network and inserts it in the inventory or tank in front of it.

Before being able to export anything, the player has to choose the items or fluids to export.

The chosen items can be configured to be NBT or damage sensitive.

The Exporter should face the block it's exporting to in a way that the wanted slot or fluid tank is possible to reach from that side.

Applicable upgrades:

-Speed Upgrade
-Stack Upgrade
-Crafting Upgrade

Welcome to your Grid!
-The Grid is a block that allows you to access items and fluids in the storage network.
-You can extract items or fluids from the central GUI.

Getting the 1k!

-Storage Disks are items where items from the storage network are stored on. It has to be put in a Disk Drive.

-Storage Blocks are blocks that provides the system with storage. It is similar to the Storage Disk, but can be placed in the world. When breaking the Storage Block, the items that it holds persist, so you won't lose any of your items.

The 1k Storage Block is a block that provides the system with storage. It is similar to the Storage Disk, but can be placed in the world.

When breaking the 1k Storage Block, the items that it holds persist, so you won't lose any of your items.

The 1k Storage Block won't despawn when dropped in the world.
Priority

A (negative or positive) priority can be chosen (where a higher priority gets higher precedence to place items in).
Whitelist and blacklist

There is also a whitelist and blacklist option to only allow or forbid some items from entering the 1k Storage Block.

The whitelist or blacklist can be configured to be NBT or damage sensitive.
Mode

The 1k Storage Block has support for the following modes:

    Insert and extract (default)
    Insert only
    Extract only

Uncrafting

Sneak and right click while holding the empty 1k Storage Block to retrieve the various parts back:

    The corresponding Storage Part
    Basic Processor
    Machine Casing

Storage

The 1k Storage Block can store 1.000 items.
Craft the 4k Storage Block. You can choose if you want to make more blocks or a 4k disk upon completion

Craft the storage disk so you learn how to make disks for the disk drive.

-A Storage Disk is an item where items from the storage network are stored on. It has to be put in a Disk Drive. The Storage Disk won't despawn when dropped in the world.

The Interface is a block that acts as a combination of the Importer and the Exporter.

For Importing:

The Importer needs to be connected to an inventory to import items or fluids. It has no internal inventory and you can't insert items directly to the Importer.

In comparison with the Importer the Interface has an internal inventory to receive items and import them (through piping, hoppers, etc). That internal inventory is accessable by opening the GUI and looking at the slots under "Interface Import").

The Interface does NOT extract items from adjacent inventories automatically, you have to actually insert them in the Interface through piping, hoppers, etc.

For Exporting:

There is also an option for exporting items from the system. These items can be piped out through a piping system from another mod, hoppers, etc.

Craft the fluid interface to store you liquids in the grid....your going to need to make the grid fluid storage but this should get you starded.

About the fluid interface:

The Fluid Interface is the same as an Interface but for fluids. It has 2 internal tanks, one for input and one for output.
Input slot. The Fluid Interface has an input slot to import the contents of fluid containers (like a filled bucket). You can also interact with the input tank by using pipes from other mods.

Output configuration:

Click a fluid container (like a filled bucket) in the "Out" slot to configure the output fluid.

Use left or right click on the fluid to change the mB amount.

Use shift to clear the fluid slot.

You can also interact with the output tank by using pipes from other mods.

Applicable upgrades:
-Speed Upgrade
-Crafting Upgrade
-Stack Upgrade

-Store your fluids. Craft this 64k storage part to get started!
-Upon completion, you have option to make the storage block or disk.

Reference info about the fluid Storage Blocks:

The 64k Fluid Storage Block is a block that provides the system with storage. It is similar to the Fluid Storage Disk, but can be placed in the world.

When breaking the 64k Fluid Storage Block, the fluids that it holds persist, so you won't lose any of your fluids.

The 64k Fluid Storage Block won't despawn when dropped in the world.
Priority

A (negative or positive) priority can be chosen (where a higher priority gets higher precedence to place items in).
Whitelist and blacklist

There is also a whitelist and blacklist option to only allow or forbid some fluid from entering the 64k Fluid Storage Block.

The whitelist or blacklist can be configured to be NBT or damage sensitive.
Mode

The 64k Fluid Storage Block has support for the following modes:

    Insert and extract (default)
    Insert only
    Extract only

Uncrafting

Sneak and right click while holding the empty 64k Fluid Storage Block to retrieve the various parts back:

    The corresponding Fluid Storage Part
    Basic Processor
    Machine Casing

Storage

The 64k Fluid Storage Block can store 64.000 millibuckets or 64 buckets of any fluid.
Now your getting there! Craft the 16k Storage Block. You can choose if you want to make more blocks or a 16k disk upon completion!

-Need more space to store that lava or other good juice! This should help.
-Completion of this quest will give you the option of making a storage block or disk...your choice!

The 4096k Fluid Storage Block is a block that provides the system with storage. It is similar to the Fluid Storage Disk, but can be placed in the world.

Storage:

The 4096k Fluid Storage Block can store 4096.000 millibuckets or 4096 buckets of any fluid.

Craft within the grid, this will be useful when setting up any type of autocrafting.

Some info about the crafting grid:

The Crafting Grid is the same as a regular Grid, but has a crafting inventory.

When an item is crafted, it won't just clear the crafting slots, but it'll try to retrieve the same items from the storage network again.
Thats alot of storage! Guess you really need the space though. Craft the 64k Storage Block. You can choose if you want to make more blocks or a 64k disk upon completion

The Pattern Grid is the same as a regular Grid, but also allows for the creation of patterns.
Mode

By default, the Pattern Grid creates regular crafting patterns.

To create processing patterns, toggle the "processing" checkbox.
Oredict

To create oredict sensitive patterns, toggle the "oredict" checkbox.
Modifying a pattern

You can re-insert a Pattern in the output slot to modify and (possibly) override it.
Recipe transferring

The Pattern Grid integrates with JEI (Just Enough Items) so the player can use recipe transferring.

You don't necessarily need the actual items in your storage network to create a Pattern for it.

A Place to store your storage disks or fluid storage disks.
-Complete this and you will earn some small space to help you get started!

A (negative or positive) priority can be chosen (where a higher priority gets higher precedence to place items in).
Whitelist and blacklist

There is also a whitelist and blacklist to only allow or forbid some items or fluids from entering the storage disks or fluid storage disks respectively.

The whitelist or blacklist can be configured to be NBT or damage sensitive.
Mode

The Disk Drive has support for the following modes:

-Insert and extract (default)
-Insert only
-Extract only

Time to Manipulate your storage and transfer items or fluids between disks.

The Disk Manipulator is a block that adds a fast way of transferring items between storage disks or fluid storage disks and the storage network.
Whitelist or blacklist

The Disk Manipulator can be configured to have a certain whitelist or blacklist of items that can be transferred. 

You can also choose whether to insert items to the storage network or extract items from the storage network.

Upgrade your RS items to add speed and other helpful things. There are many different types of upgrades including fortune and interdimensional options. Completing this Quest should get you started in how to craft and use thse items.

RS upgrade options that can be used in the equipment:

-Speed Upgrade
-Range Upgrade
-Crafting Upgrade
-Stack Upgrade
-Interdimensional Upgrade
-Silk Touch Upgrade
-Fortune Upgrade

A place for patterns.

The Crafter is a block that crafts items with patterns. It can take speed upgrades to increase the crafting speed.

With processing patterns, the Crafter has to face the correct input side of the machine.

Finish this quest to obtain the craft manager that allows you to see all your patterns in one GUI.

Cutting the wires and upgrading to a wireless crafting or remote system? This will get you started.

Wireless Transmitters are used to send signals to wireless network items in Refined Storage.

Keep in mind that you have to place the Wireless Transmitter on RS Cable.

Default range is 16 blocks, but can be upgraded with RS range upgrades so try to space out your transmitters accordingly to maximize coverage.

Ready to access the grid wirelessly and access your items from anywhere?

Crafting up the wireless grid will get you started. Once you craft this item, to activate the Wireless Grid, right click the Wireless Grid on a Controller.

To use the Wireless Grid the item needs Forge Energy. You'll have to charge it in a block that charges items from another mod.

Make sure you have your wireless transmitters on the network to get a basic range of 16 blocks, and it should light up blue when ready.

Completing this quest you will get a wireless grid that will allow you to craft on the fly and some more ender to help take you more into the mod.

Remember there are other useful wireless options available in the RS mod to help you along in your adventure so be sure to check them out!

Network Transmitters send a network signal to a Network Receiver that is specified in the given Network Card. 

The Network Card is an item that stores the coordinates of a Network Receiver, insert the Network Card in a Network Transmitter.

Network Receivers will receive the signal from the Network Transmitter.

In order for the Network Receiver to work reliably the Network Receiver and tranmitter should be chunkloaded. 

See Extra Utilities chunk loader or FTB utilties claimed chunks map menu icon in-game to load up chunks.

The Interdimensional Upgrade is an upgrade that allows the Network Transmitter to work cross-dimensionally.

This upgrade takes a lot of extra FE/t by default (1000 FE/t extra).

Connect up some external storage!

The External Storage block provides the grid with storage of the inventory or fluid tank in front of the device such as chests or drawers.
